si.title: එක්සත් ජනපද මැතිවරණ ප්රති come ල සහ වෙළඳ ප්රතිපත්ති වෙනස්කම්: ශ්රී ලංකාව සඳහා එහි තේරුම කුමක්ද?
body_lines: දැන් එක්සත් ජනපදය (එක්සත් ජනපද) මැතිවරණය අවසන් වී ඇත්තේ, එක්සත් ජනපදයේ වෙළඳ ප්රතිපත්තිය මෙහෙයවනු ලබන මඟ පෙන්වීම කුමක්ද?ජනාධිපතිවරණයෙන් ඉක්බිතිව එහි වෙළඳ හවුල්කරුවන්ගෙන් බොහෝ දෙනෙකුගේ ප්රශ්න වලින් එකක් මෙයයි.
මිල අධික වෙළඳ යුද්ධයක් වූයේ 2018 දී ගාස්තු ඉහළ යාමේ ප්රති come ලයකි - ජනාධිපති තුරුම්පු මහතාගේ පළමු වාරය - එක්සත් ජනපදයේ වෙළඳ හවුල්කරුවන්ගේ පළිගැනීමේ ගාස්තු අනුගමනය කරන ලදී.

දෙවන වාරයක් සඳහා තේරී පත් වූ ඔහු නැවත වරක් වෙළඳ ප්රතිපත්ති ක්රියාමාර්ග ලෙස සැලකිය යුතු තීරුබදු වැඩි කිරීම යෝජනා කරයි. එක්සත් ජනපද තීරුත ප්රතිපත්ති වල මෙම විභව වෙනස්කම් ශ්රී ලංකාවේ අපනයන කර්මාන්ත කෙරෙහි සෘජු බලපෑමක් ඇති කරනු ඇත. The US is the top individual export destination of Sri Lanka, accounting for 23.6% of its total exports (Figure 1).Market share of export destinations of Sri Lanka: 2023

The economic justification for a global tariff on imports and its efficacy in achieving the expected results – such as the reshoring of manufacturing employment to the US and price reduction – remains uncertain. මෙම ලිපිය ප්රධාන වශයෙන් අවධානය යොමු කරන්නේ ශ්රී ලංකාවේ අපනයන එක්සත් ජනපදයට ඇති අපනයන මත තීරු දැමීමේ අහිතකර බලපෑම් කෙරෙහි ය.
වත්මන් එක්සත් ජනපද පරිපාලනය විසින් උද්ධමන අඩු කිරීමේ පනත යටතේ හඳුන්වා දුන් පාරිභෝගික සහනාධාර පදනම් කරගත් කාර්මික ප්රතිපත්තිය අඛණ්ඩව පවතිනු ඇතැයි අපේක්ෂා කෙරේ.

However, the effect of a tariff is more direct than a consumer subsidy. On the campaign trail, the US president-elect proposed 10 percentage points on US imports. මෙය නව අවම ගාස්තුවකට වඩා 10% තීරුබදුවක් ලෙස වටහාගෙන ඇත. It implies that there will be an additional 10 percentage point tariff on the existing average tariff rate of 12.6% on the wearing apparel sector, for instance, if the proposed tariff is implemented

10% ක අතිරේක ගාස්තුවක් 10% වෙනුවට 20% අතිරේක තීරුබදුවක් සඳහා යෝජනාවක් යෝජනා කළ අයකිරීම් වැඩිවීමේ නිශ්චිත අනුපාතය අපැහැදිලි වේ.. In addition, a 60% to 100% tariff is proposed on imports from China. එක්සත් ජනපද නිෂ්පාදන සෑම රටකම මුහුණ දෙන අනුපාතයන් සමඟ එක්සත් ජනපද ගාස්තු පෙළගැස්වීමට වඩා සංකීර්ණ, රට විශේෂිත පළිගැනීමේ තීරුබදු කාලසටහනක් එක්සත් ජනපද ගාස්තු පෙළ ගැසීමට යෝජනා කර තිබේ.

ආනයනික භාණ්ඩ සඳහා පාරිභෝගික ඉල්ලුම අඩු කිරීමට එක්සත් ජනපද තීරුබදු වැඩි කිරීමකි. මීට අමතරව, එක්සත් ජනපදය සහ එහි වෙළඳ හවුල්කරුවන්ගේ වෙළඳ ගැටුමකින් අවුලුවන යුරෝපීය සංගමයේ (යුරෝපා සංගමයේ) ආර්ථික පසුබෑමක් ශ්රී ලංකාවේ අපනයන සඳහා ඉල්ලුම තවදුරටත් මර්දනය කළ හැකිය.

සියලුම රටවල් සඳහා පවත්නා සාමාන්ය ගාස්තු මත අතිරේක 20% ක ගාස්තුවක් අය කරන්නේ නම්, ඇස්තමේන්තු වලින් පෙනී යන්නේ ශ්රී ලංකාව එක්සත් ජනපදයට අපනයනය සැලකිය යුතු negative ණාත්මක බලපෑමක් ඇති කරනු ඇති බවයි (රූපය 2). නිදසුනක් වශයෙන්, ඇඟලුම් පැළඳීම, ශ්රී ලංකාවේ ප්රධාන අපනයන අංශයට ඇමරිකානු ඩොලර් මිලියන 187.9 ක අලාභයක් සිදුවනු ඇත. ප්රතිශතයක් ලෙස, මෙය 2022, මූලික වර්ෂයේ සිට 8.1% හැකිලීමකි.

According to the estimates, the proposed tariffs will severely impact Sri Lanka’s exports of rubber and plastic products, as well as other manufactured products like Christmas decorations, brooms and brushes (Figure 2).
ප්රතිශතයක් ලෙස සක්රිය කාබන් සහ අත්යවශ්ය තෙල් ඇතුළත් රසායනික නිෂ්පාදන අංශයේ අපනයන අලාභයෙන් 90% ක් පමණ අපේක්ෂා කළ හැකිය.
If the US imposes a 60% to 100% tariff on imports from China, relatively high pricing on Chinese products could benefit countries like Sri Lanka from trade diversion.
However, the overall rise in import prices resulting from a broader trade war will drastically reduce the US demand for imports, limiting the gains from this trade diversion.

The US trade partners will retaliate with tariffs, similar to the China-US trade war in 2018. The proposed tariff is estimated to cost an average US household more than USD 2,600 a year, once retaliatory tariffs are factored into the analysis. Additionally, the slowdown of US growth, as a possible consequence of a tariff war, will further reduce the country’s import demand.

The spillover effects of tariff wars will also negatively affect Sri Lanka as the EU countries are expected to experience a substantial economic setback. It is estimated that the EU may see its GDP erode by 1.5%, or about Euro 260 billion.
An economic contraction in the EU will reduce the EU imports from Sri Lanka significantly. Thus, the estimated effects in this article can be considered only as the first-round effects.
ප්රචාරක වාචාලකම හෝ විශ්වසනීය තර්ජනයක්?තීරුබදු වැඩිවීමේ සම්භාවිතාව සහ

A blanket tariff increase and an intense trade war between China and the US will drive up the domestic prices in the US, fuelling fear of inflationary pressure. Accordingly, it is unlikely that the proposed tariffs will be fully implemented given the significant impact of inflation on elections in the US.

As the protectionist measures target the US’s manufacturing sector, sub-sectors like light household equipment, decorations, metal products, and machinery may become more vulnerable to future tariff shocks.
These non-traditional exports of Sri Lanka play a major role in export diversification and are generally more complex and technologically sophisticated.

As a small exporting economy, Sri Lanka is susceptible to external factors that are beyond its control. මීට අමතරව, එක්සත් ජනපද භාණ්ඩ ගැනුම්කරුවෙකු ලෙස ශ්රී ලංකාවේ සීමිත කාර්යභාරය නිසා අඩු ගාස්තු සඳහා වන හැකියාව සීමා කරයි. එහි ප්රති As ලයක් ලෙස, අනාගත එක්සත් ජනපදයේ තීරුබදු කම්පනවල ප්රතිචාරවල මෙවලම් පෙට්ටිය තුළ ආන්තික ගැලපීම් පමණි.

අමුද්රව්ය සඳහා ආනයන ගාස්තු සහන ලබා දීම සහ විදුලි නිෂ්පාදනකරුවන්ට ඔවුන්ගේ තරඟකාරිත්වය පවත්වා ගැනීම සඳහා විදුලි සහනාධාර සඳහා නිෂ්පාදන සහනාධාර ලබා දීම මෙයට ඇතුළත් විය හැකිය. A consultation with the producers in this regard will enable the government to determine the most effective policy measures.

In the medium term, given the global rise of protectionist and industrial policy measures in major export destinations, Sri Lanka will need to maintain preferential tariffs in other regions like the EU.
It will be vital for Sri Lanka to maintain the GSP+ preference and renewed attempts for increased cumulation to increase the GSP+ utilisation will benefit Sri Lanka.

එක්සත් ජනපදයේ සහ යුරෝපා සංගමයේ අපේක්ෂිත ඉහළ තීරුබදු සහ කලාපීය වෙළඳ කේන්ද්රස්ථාන (RCEP) වැනි කලාපීය වෙළඳ කබාය (RCEP) හා සම්බන්ධ වීම අරමුණු කර ගනිමින් ශ්රී ලංකාව වෙළඳ ප්රතිපත්ති ප්රතිසංස්කරණ පවත්වාගෙන යා යුතු අතර.
ආචාර්ය අසංකා විජේසිංහ මහතා සාර්ව ආර්ථික ප්රතිපත්තිය, ජාත්යන්තර වෙළඳාම, ශ්රම හා සෞඛ්ය විද්යා ආර්ථික විද්යාව පිළිබඳ පර්යේෂණ අවශ්යතා සහිත පර්යේෂණ සාමාජිකයෙකු බව.

He holds a BSc in Agricultural Technology and Management from the University of Peradeniya, an MS in Agribusiness and Applied Economics from North Dakota State University, and an MS and PhD in Agricultural, Environmental and Development Economics from The Ohio State University.
Grassroots participation by researchers vital to understand people’s aspirations – Dr. වින්යා ආරියරත්න
Leave a Reply Cancel replyYour email address will not be published. අවශ්ය ක්ෂේත්ර * අදහස් දැක්වීම * නම *

ta.title: அமெரிக்க தேர்தல் முடிவுகள் மற்றும் வர்த்தக கொள்கை மாற்றங்கள்: இலங்கைக்கு என்ன அர்த்தம்
body_lines: Now that the United States (US) election has concluded, what direction will the US’s trade policy be headed? This is one of the burning questions that many of its trading partners are asking in the aftermath of the presidential election.
A costly trade war was the outcome of the tariff hikes in 2018 – under the first term of President Trump – which was followed by retaliatory tariffs from the US’s trade partners.

Elected for a second term, he is once again proposing significant tariff increases as trade policy measures. அமெரிக்க கட்டணக் கொள்கைகளில் இந்த சாத்தியமான மாற்றங்கள் இலங்கையின் ஏற்றுமதி தொழில்களில் நேரடி தாக்கத்தை ஏற்படுத்தும். The US is the top individual export destination of Sri Lanka, accounting for 23.6% of its total exports (Figure 1).Market share of export destinations of Sri Lanka: 2023

The economic justification for a global tariff on imports and its efficacy in achieving the expected results – such as the reshoring of manufacturing employment to the US and price reduction – remains uncertain. This article mainly focuses on the adverse impacts of a tariff increase on Sri Lanka’s exports to the US.
The consumer subsidy-based industrial policy, introduced under the Inflation Reduction Act by the incumbent US administration is expected to continue.

However, the effect of a tariff is more direct than a consumer subsidy. On the campaign trail, the US president-elect proposed 10 percentage points on US imports. இது ஒரு புதிய குறைந்தபட்ச கட்டணத்தை விட கூடுதல் 10% கட்டணமாக புரிந்து கொள்ளப்படுகிறது. It implies that there will be an additional 10 percentage point tariff on the existing average tariff rate of 12.6% on the wearing apparel sector, for instance, if the proposed tariff is implemented

The precise rate of the tariff increase remains ambiguous, as a proposal for a 20% additional tariff was suggested later instead of the 10%. In addition, a 60% to 100% tariff is proposed on imports from China. Also, a more complex, country-specific retaliatory tariff schedule has been proposed to align US tariffs with the rates that the US products face in each country.

An increase in the US tariffs is likely to reduce consumer demand for imported goods. Additionally, an economic downturn in the European Union (EU), triggered by a trade conflict between the US and its trading partners, could further suppress demand for Sri Lanka’s exports.

எல்லா நாடுகளுக்கும் தற்போதுள்ள சராசரி கட்டணங்களுக்கு மேல் கூடுதலாக 20% கட்டணங்கள் பயன்படுத்தப்பட்டால், அமெரிக்காவிற்கு இலங்கையின் ஏற்றுமதிகள் குறிப்பிடத்தக்க எதிர்மறை தாக்கத்தை சந்திக்கும் என்று மதிப்பிடுகிறது (படம் 2). For example, wearing apparel, Sri Lanka’s major export sector will experience a loss of USD 187.9 Million. As a percentage, this is a contraction of 8.1% from the base year, 2022.

மதிப்பீடுகளின்படி, முன்மொழியப்பட்ட கட்டணங்கள் இலங்கையின் ரப்பர் மற்றும் பிளாஸ்டிக் பொருட்களின் ஏற்றுமதியையும், கிறிஸ்துமஸ் அலங்காரங்கள், விளக்குமாறு மற்றும் தூரிகைகள் போன்ற பிற தயாரிக்கப்பட்ட தயாரிப்புகளையும் கடுமையாக பாதிக்கும் (படம் 2).
As a percentage, about 90% of export loss can be expected in the chemical products sector which includes activated carbon, and essential oil.
If the US imposes a 60% to 100% tariff on imports from China, relatively high pricing on Chinese products could benefit countries like Sri Lanka from trade diversion.

எவ்வாறாயினும், ஒரு பரந்த வர்த்தக யுத்தத்தின் விளைவாக இறக்குமதி விலைகளின் ஒட்டுமொத்த உயர்வு இறக்குமதிக்கான அமெரிக்க தேவையை வெகுவாகக் குறைக்கும், இந்த வர்த்தக திசைதிருப்பலிலிருந்து ஆதாயங்களைக் கட்டுப்படுத்துகிறது.

அமெரிக்க வர்த்தக பங்காளிகள் 2018 ஆம் ஆண்டில் சீனா-அமெரிக்க வர்த்தகப் போரைப் போலவே கட்டணங்களுடன் பதிலடி கொடுப்பார்கள். The proposed tariff is estimated to cost an average US household more than USD 2,600 a year, once retaliatory tariffs are factored into the analysis. கூடுதலாக, அமெரிக்க வளர்ச்சியின் மந்தநிலை, கட்டணப் போரின் விளைவாக, நாட்டின் இறக்குமதி தேவையை மேலும் குறைக்கும்.

The spillover effects of tariff wars will also negatively affect Sri Lanka as the EU countries are expected to experience a substantial economic setback. ஐரோப்பிய ஒன்றியம் அதன் மொத்த உள்நாட்டு உற்பத்தியை 1.5%அல்லது யூரோ 260 பில்லியனால் அரிக்கலாம் என்று மதிப்பிடப்பட்டுள்ளது.
An economic contraction in the EU will reduce the EU imports from Sri Lanka significantly. Thus, the estimated effects in this article can be considered only as the first-round effects.
Campaign Rhetoric or a Credible Threat? The ikelihood of Tariff Hikes and

A blanket tariff increase and an intense trade war between China and the US will drive up the domestic prices in the US, fuelling fear of inflationary pressure. Accordingly, it is unlikely that the proposed tariffs will be fully implemented given the significant impact of inflation on elections in the US.

பாதுகாப்புவாத நடவடிக்கைகள் அமெரிக்காவின் உற்பத்தித் துறையை குறிவைப்பதால், ஒளி வீட்டு உபகரணங்கள், அலங்காரங்கள், உலோக தயாரிப்புகள் மற்றும் இயந்திரங்கள் போன்ற துணைத் துறைகள் எதிர்கால கட்டண அதிர்ச்சிகளுக்கு மிகவும் பாதிக்கப்படக்கூடும்.
These non-traditional exports of Sri Lanka play a major role in export diversification and are generally more complex and technologically sophisticated.

As a small exporting economy, Sri Lanka is susceptible to external factors that are beyond its control. Additionally, Sri Lanka’s limited role as a purchaser of US commodities limits its ability to negotiate lower tariffs. இதன் விளைவாக, எதிர்கால அமெரிக்க கட்டண அதிர்ச்சிகளுக்கான பதில்களின் கருவிப்பெட்டியில் ஓரளவு மாற்றங்கள் மட்டுமே உள்ளன.

These may include offering import tariff relief for raw materials and providing production subsidies, such as electricity subsidies, to support domestic producers in maintaining their competitiveness. இது தொடர்பாக தயாரிப்பாளர்களுடன் ஒரு ஆலோசனை அரசாங்கத்திற்கு மிகவும் பயனுள்ள கொள்கை நடவடிக்கைகளைத் தீர்மானிக்க உதவும்.

In the medium term, given the global rise of protectionist and industrial policy measures in major export destinations, Sri Lanka will need to maintain preferential tariffs in other regions like the EU.
It will be vital for Sri Lanka to maintain the GSP+ preference and renewed attempts for increased cumulation to increase the GSP+ utilisation will benefit Sri Lanka.

அமெரிக்காவிலும் ஐரோப்பிய ஒன்றியத்திலும் எதிர்பார்க்கப்படும் உயர் கட்டணங்களும் தொழில்நுட்ப தடைகளும் எதிர்காலத்தில் சாத்தியமானவை என்பதால், பிராந்திய விரிவான பொருளாதார கூட்டு (RCEP) போன்ற பிராந்திய வர்த்தக முகாம்களில் சேர இலங்கை வர்த்தக கொள்கை சீர்திருத்தங்களை பராமரிக்க வேண்டும்.
Dr Asanka Wijesinghe is a Research Fellow at IPS with research interests in macroeconomic policy, international trade, labour and health economics.

பெரடேனியா பல்கலைக்கழகத்தில் விவசாய தொழில்நுட்பம் மற்றும் நிர்வாகத்தில் பி.எஸ்.சி, வடக்கு டகோட்டா மாநில பல்கலைக்கழகத்தில் வேளாண் வணிகம் மற்றும் பயன்பாட்டு பொருளாதாரத்தில் எம்.எஸ் மற்றும் ஓஹியோ மாநில பல்கலைக்கழகத்தில் விவசாய, சுற்றுச்சூழல் மற்றும் மேம்பாட்டு பொருளாதாரத்தில் எம்.எஸ் மற்றும் பி.எச்.டி.
Grassroots participation by researchers vital to understand people’s aspirations – Dr. Vinya Ariyaratne
